page.title: 06SHOPPING IN BISHOP MIDDLEHAM
page.content:
There are not many shops in the area and those that are tend to be very small. In the village the Post Office is predominant in its use by the villagers. The Post Office also sells groceries, fruit and sweets as well as cards for varying occasions.
There is also a Newsagents and a Butchers. The local milkman also sells milk from his own house.
Villagers tend to do the bulk of their shopping in the larger stores to be found in the nearby towns and cities, using the local shops for items they run out of or have forgotten.
